image.altText: A small square robot has four white wheels, it wheels through white sand

props.synopsis: A Queensland-based consortium will design, build and operate the Australian first Moon rover, which is set to launch later this decade.

title.children: Builder chosen for Roo-ver, the little robot who will head to the Moon

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: A woman who disguised herself as someone living with a disability and used a solution which had "a smell of chilli about it" and a homemade taser to steal jewellery was trying clear debts owed to a drug syndicate, a court has heard.

title.children: Woman who sprayed shopkeeper's face with suspected chilli solution faces court

image.altText: A close-up of the blades of a windmill, standing over a dirt path and some lakes.

props.synopsis: Millions of tonnes of soil and rock from the Torrens to Darlington tunnel project will be processed at a site in Adelaide's north, despite concerns about the potential contamination risk to nearby wetlands.

title.children: Environmentalists raise concerns Gillman proposal will put wetlands at risk

image.altText: KI desal plant 2

props.synopsis: The desalination plant is meant to service American Beach, Baudin Beach, Island Beach and Sapphiretown, but some people in those areas have been told they cannot be connected.Â

title.children: New $150m Kangaroo Island desal plant unable to connect to all households

image.altText: Heat makes for restless nights

props.synopsis: Public life ground to a halt, many lost power, and scores of people died behind closed doors. What sounds like the start of a post-apocalyptic movie is in fact Melbourne in January 2009.

title.children: Australia's deadliest natural disaster flew under the radar but killed hundreds

image.altText: A single bed in a room at the new youth training centre

props.synopsis: Nearly one in two incarcerated children in South Australia have been prescribed a supplement to help them fall asleep, amid concerns about "unusual" night-time behaviours.

title.children: Doctors concerned by melatonin prescriptions to children at detention centre

image.altText: A close up on a two-month-old baby's face, with its right hand on its cheek.

props.synopsis: The family of a baby injured in a shocking home invasion in Alice Springs thanks the community for its support after a fundraiser drew more than $52,000 in donations.

title.children: $52,000 raised for baby injured in Alice Springs home invasion

image.altText: A river with very green water snakes through trees.

props.synopsis: Extreme heat forecast across western NSW has river rangers, locals and the state government worried about the possibility of another mass fish kill.

title.children: Fish kill fears as Darling River turns a sickly shade of green

image.altText: An aerial view showing land with trees and the ocean.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners express immense disappointment at the approval of Billy Lights Point as the site for a desalination plant in South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: 'Wrong location' for $330m desal plant, traditional owners say

image.altText: Police in hazmat suits in bushland investigating.

props.synopsis:
The second body has been found near where a 33-year-old woman's remains were discovered wrapped in a plastic bag near Sydney Airport last week.Â 
Â

title.children: Police treating discovery of second body in Botany as 'targeted double murder'

image.altText: Blurred Graffiti under bridge in Sefton

props.synopsis: In his first media interview, Australia's Special Envoy to Combat Islamophobia has described the targeting of Muslims as a "hidden cancer".

title.children: Islamic leader says 'very public display of hate' reflects many abhorrent messages

image.altText: A blue Meta logo placed on the keyboard of a silver laptop

props.synopsis: Facebook's parent company has agreed to a landmark payment over the Cambridge Analytica privacy scandal.

title.children: Meta agrees to pay Australian Facebook users in $50 million settlement

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: New Treasury figures show the top tenth of earners are hauling in tens of billions of dollars from tax concessions and loopholes.

title.children: One million Australians are negatively gearing, new tax figures show

image.altText: Victoria Police outside Flinders Street Station

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has pledged to introduce a raft of new restrictions on protesters, including banning protests from being held near places of worship.

title.children: Victoria unveils ban on protester face masks, locks and glue

image.altText: An aerial shot of a flooded road.

props.synopsis: Parts of Queensland have been submerged by flash flooding overnight, with more rainfall predicted in the next 24 hours.

title.children: Flash flooding hits parts of Queensland as extreme heatwave warning issued

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference in brisbane

props.synopsis: Details of the coming promise to voters, which follows months of consultation with the gas industry, are being calibrated to counter Labor's likely strategy of ongoing direct-to-households energy bill relief.

title.children: Dutton to revive Morrison's 'gas-fired recovery' in election pledge to cut energy bills

image.altText: Two men in suits smiling, while holding glasses of wine and looking at each other

props.synopsis: Ukraine's military intelligence agency and the Pentagon say about 30 North Korean troops were killed or wounded during a battle with the Ukrainian army.Â

title.children: First North Korean deaths reported in Russia-Ukraine conflict

image.altText: A collage of pictures of a young boy with brown hair, some with family members.

props.synopsis: Heartbroken relatives are paying tribute to an "inquisitive, car-loving" 10-year-old Victorian boy who died in a car boot during a game of hide-and-seek on Sunday.Â

title.children: Family says 'inquisitive' boy who died in car boot was playing 'hide and seek'

image.altText: Aboriginal dancer at Currumbin Sanctuary

props.synopsis: The Tourism office is slammed for spending three-quarters of its budget on contractors, with most of those contracts made through closed-door arrangements.

title.children: Tourism Australia spent three-quarters of its budget on contractors

image.altText: A woman wearing a black head covering with tears in her eyes

props.synopsis: More than 1 million Syrian refugees poured over the border into Lebanon during the country's horrific civil war, and many are now considering returning.

title.children: Uncertainty for Syrian refugees waiting for safe return after Assad's fall

image.altText: A Mobil sign near fuel bowsers

props.synopsis: The consumer watchdog alleges fuel sold at several service stations in Queensland did not contain additives which the company claimed would protect customers' engines.

title.children: Mobil says it regrets misleading customers as ACCC launches legal action

image.altText: Novak Djokovic and Nick Kyrgios pose for a photograph, with their thumbs up and smiling, on a tennis court

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios will team up with Novak Djokovic at the Brisbane International after crediting the former world number one for motivating his return from serious injury.

title.children: Kyrgios announces Djokovic as doubles partner for Brisbane

image.altText: Donald trump in a suit with his fist in the air.

props.synopsis: A judge has rejected Donald Trump's bid to have his "hush money" conviction dismissed on the basis of the US Supreme Court's recent ruling on presidential immunity.

title.children: Judge rejects Trump's bid to dismiss Stormy Daniels hush money conviction

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Crown Prosecution Service defends the verdicts, saying two juries and three appeal court judges have already "reviewed a multitude of different strands of evidence against Lucy Letby".Â

title.children: Lucy Letby's lawyer wants killer nurse's convictions re-examined

image.altText: Aboriginal woman in purple shirt sitting in chair

props.synopsis: When the ABC visited Alpurrurulam, a tiny outback town on the Northern Territory-Queensland border, all anyone in town wanted to talk about was what was happening at the local school.

title.children: Allegations of bullying and inappropriate behaviour at outback school

image.altText: An emergency vehicle behind police tape and a school sign.

props.synopsis:
A school shooting in Wisconsin was the 323rd in the US this year. Here's what the data tells us about the shooters, the victims and which states are worst-hit.

Â 

Â Â

title.children: In numbers: 2024 US school shootings second-highest since 1966

image.altText: Donald Trump points as he stands in front of a gold-gilded wall and an American flag.

props.synopsis: In a wide-ranging Q&A with the press in Florida, the president-elect talks about topics ranging from the Middle East to the future of TikTok.

title.children: Five takeaways from Trump's first post-election press conference

image.altText: Darren Lehmann shakes Nathan McSweeney's hand as he awards him his baggy green cap for his Test debut.

props.synopsis: Darren Lehmann says he is worried that current chairman of selectors George Bailey is "too close" to the team, which could make difficult decisions over dropping veterans harder.

title.children: Former coach fears Australian Test selectors are 'too close' to the team

image.altText: Marked and unmarked police cars on a street

props.synopsis: A shooting at a private Christian school in the US state of Wisconsin leaves three people dead, including the child behind the attack.

title.children: Teenage girl shoots fellow student and teacher dead  in Wisconsin school attack

image.altText: Photo of a machine spreading human waste.

props.synopsis: A Sydney Water document reveals sewage by-products used in food production contain elevated levels of PFAS.

title.children: Sewage by-products used on farms contaminated with 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: A green electric vehicle parked in an underground charging bay.

props.synopsis: Strata owners are increasingly banning electric vehicles from charging in basement carparks as fire safety authorities disagree over the risk of battery fires.

title.children: EVs in apartment carparks a battleground amid fight over right to charge

image.altText: Kato the Bengal tiger at Dreamworld on May 23, 2011.

props.synopsis: Dreamworld's staff will no longer physically interact with its big cats.Â

title.children: Dreamworld theme park to end human interaction with tigers after big-cat attack

image.altText: The front of an iron ore train

props.synopsis: Poor sleep, increased stress and spider bites contributed to a train crash on a BHP iron ore site at Port Hedland earlier this year, a national transport safety watchdog report has found.

title.children: Fatigue, spider bites contributed to BHP train crash in WA's north

image.altText: Melbourne Victory head coach Patrick Kisnorbo punching his fist in the air, celebrating

props.synopsis: Patrick Kisnorbo has made a shock departure from Melbourne Victory as coach, only six months into a three-year deal, to take up an opportunity overseas.

title.children: Victory boss leaves club less than six months into role

image.altText: cartoon picture of sailor reaching for a can of spinach

props.synopsis: Popeye and Tintin are among the iconic works to enter the public domain in the US from next year.

title.children: Popeye and Tintin enter the public domain in 2025
